meanings.definition: To break through or make a hole in (a wall, barrier, or defense)
meanings.sent1: The determined squirrel breached the bird feeder to get to the seeds.
meanings.sent2: The burglars breached the security system and entered the building undetected.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon breached the garden fence to steal some strawberries.
meanings.sent4: The flood breached the dam, causing widespread destruction downstream.
meanings.sent5: The knight breached the castle walls with a battering ram, leading his army to victory.

meanings.definition: To fail to observe or keep (a law, agreement, or code of conduct)
meanings.sent1: She breached the school rules by using her phone during class.
meanings.sent2: The company breached the contract by not delivering the goods on time.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy breached the no-jumping-on-the-couch rule as soon as the owner left.
meanings.sent4: His constant tardiness breached the company's policy on punctuality.
meanings.sent5: The student breached the exam rules by attempting to cheat during the test.

meanings.definition: To leap out of the water (of a whale or dolphin)
meanings.sent1: The majestic whale breached the surface of the ocean, spraying water everywhere.
meanings.sent2: Tourists on the boat cheered as the dolphins breached in a synchronized display.
meanings.sent3: The playful dolphin breached repeatedly, showing off its acrobatic skills.
meanings.sent4: The orca breached dramatically, showcasing its immense power and grace.
meanings.sent5: The humpback whale breached with a loud splash, captivating everyone on the nearby ship.
